results.title: 330 million gods
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Long Search”.
Ronald Eyre begins his search for the answers to the great philosophical questions of experience in India, home of 330 million gods. He discovers that Hinduism is really a philosophy of life rather than a religion. He visits Benares and a small village to discover what religion means to the ordinary people of India as they perform their daily rituals and celebrate festivals associated with their local deity. Much of the discussion hinges on the meaning of symbols, ritual and what is a God.

results.title: 30 minutes, Mister Plummer
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jacques Bobet and Anne-Claire Poirier
results.brief_description: This film profiles Canadian actor Christopher Plummer of the Shakespearean Theater, Stratford, Ontario. As the minutes tick by, cameras register the transformation as he dons his make-up for the title role in Cyrano de Bergerac. We also see Toronto actress Kate Reid. (Award: Bergamo.)

results.title: 3:10 to Yuma = Three ten to Yuma
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, David Heilwell and Delmer Daves
results.brief_description: After a stage coach hold-up and killing, outlaw Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) is captured. Fearing a daring rescue by Wade’s gang who are too strong for the local lawmen to handle, a large bounty is offered to anyone willing to escort Wade by train to the state prison in Yuma. Hard hit by the crippling drought and attracted by the generous sum, rancher Dan Evans (Van Heflin) takes on the job. He collects Wade and begins the dangerous trek to the station.

results.title: 3.10 to Yuma [study extract] = Three ten to Yuma
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Critic and the Film”.
John Freeman discusses the film “3.10 to Yuma”, an example of the “psychological western”. He illustrates three important functions of the critic; analysis, interpretation and evaluation. Shows that criticism can be both entertaining in itself, and increase the pleasure obtained from the film. He avoids talking down to his audience yet he conveys a sense of authority. He exposes the cliche, which even the serious western cannot escape, with considerable humour.

results.title: 3,900 million and one
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Oxfam and Anthony Mayer
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World around us”.
Examines the way of life of a farming family living in the south of India. Provides an insight into the benefits and problems associated with the extended family system in rural India.

results.title: 3,000 Years of Conflict
results.creator_credit: East Coast Productions, Dennis Porter and Ian Austin
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
Breathtaking in scope,”3,000 Years of Conflict” traces India’s turbulent history from the Aryan invaders in 1500 BC to Independence in 1947.

results.title: 3 years = Three years
results.brief_description: For Calvin, joining up with Green Corps when he was 20 proved to be a turning point in his life. Motivated and inspired by the people he met in Green Corps, three years on, he is now successfully employed, confident and making the most of every opportunity that comes his way.

results.title: 3 seconds from glory. [Part 2]
results.creator_credit: Spirit 2000 Productions, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and David Goldie
results.brief_description: Part two of a 2-part documentary about four young female Paralympians in the pursuit of excellence. Retraces footage from part one where the focus was perhaps a bit more on Christie and Holly to focusing on Angie and in particular, Louise, whose motivation and leadership enables the younger girls to be confident and mentally prepared for the big event. Two of them, Angie and Holly, had not even ventured overseas, let alone had the chance to experience the heat of international competition. But their lack of experience didn’t prevent these young Australian women from reaching for their dreams. Their immediate goal: win Australia’s first gold medal in the World Championship event. The second goal: break the world record. Presented and narrated by David Goldie.
